Sentencas: Ammonia is considered to be one of the most promising candidates as the fuel for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, nitrogen oxide formation was thermodynamically determined as a function of ammonia conversion rate and temperature.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The result showed that more NO was formed at higher temperature.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, ammonia was experimentally investigated as the fuel for an intermediate-temperature SOFC (IT-SOFC) consisted of a Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) anode, an SDC (50 mu m) electrolyte, and an Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3-delta (SSC)-SDC cathode.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The components of anode off-gas were analyzed both theoretically and experimentally, especially for the possibility of nitrogen oxide formation.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Performances of the cells fueled with ammonia and hydrogen were quite similar at the same temperatures.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Maximum power densities were 168.1 and 191.8 mW cm(-2) at 600 degrees C with ammonia and hydrogen as the fuels, respectively.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrode polarization resistances and electrolyte resistances of cells fueled by ammonia and hydrogen were characterized by AC impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The long-term endurance of cells in ammonia was also tested.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ammonia in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
